newsitem.title: THAILAND: Thai rubber prices up further in slow trade.
newsitem.headline: Thai rubber prices up further in slow trade.

text.p: Thai rubber prices firmed further this week in slow trade as sellers withheld stocks in anticipation of further rises, industry sources said on Friday.
"The rubber prices continued an upward trend from last week in line with the rise in Japan's market," said a Hat Yai-based trader.
"But market activities were very slow. People did not want to sell rubber as they expected prices will rise further," the trader added.
Benchmark RSS3 for March shipment was quoted at around $1.23 kg FOB Bangkok on Friday from $1.19 on the same basis last week, traders said.
Latex was quoted at around $0.94 a kg for March deliveries against $0.92 last week.
